extractedText: Why AI and AR Are the Stars of the Show at the JCK Jewelry Show Elegance, tradition, luxury, and craftsmanship, these words come to anyone’s mind when we hear the word ‘jewelry.’ However, in recent years, leading players at the JCK Las Vegas event—widely regarded as the most influential jewelry trade show—are showcasing a new sparkel. AI and AR technology. AT JCK Vegas, top jewelry brands are transforming the way customers interact with fine jewelry using virtual try-on experiences, digital product a showcase, and immersive personalization tools. Due to technological advancement and growing demand for convenience, personalization, and digital-first experiences, AI and AR innovations have taken center stage at the JCK show. So why exactly are brands investing heavily in these technologies? And how can your jewelry business ride the same wave of innovation? So, let’s delve into it and find out the role of AI and AR in the jewelry industry along with explore how it’s redefining the customer experience at the JCK jewelry show and beyond. What is AI and AR Technology in Jewelry? Artificial Intelligence (AI) is not something new, we all know about it from the last decade. However, if you don’t then let me explain. AI refers to a computer system that simulates human intelligence to perform tasks like visual recognition, decision making, and data analysis. In the jewelry space, AI helps brands in offering personalized recommendations, manage inventory smartly, and predict style trends based on consumer behavior. Augmented Reality (AR), on the other hand, blends digital content with the real world. In jewelry, AR allows customers to virtually try on jewellery such as rings, necklaces, bangles, and earrings try on through a mobile device or in-store mirrors. This interactive layer allows buyers to visualize how products look on them—anytime, anywhere. Together, AI and AR technology are driving the next evolution of jewelry retail—both online and offline. This offers a perfect mix of style, science, and smooth engagement. Use Case of AI and AR Technology ​ Top Jewlery brands at JCK Las Vegas are integrating AI nd AR across the entire customer journey. For instance: Virtual tryon platforms let shoppers see how a diamond necklace or a pair of earrings try on their face in real-time, limiting the guesswork about how it will look. AI-driven chatbots assist with product queries and offer personalized styling tips based on skin tone, face shape, and previous preferences. AR-powered store displays allow customers at JCK Vegas booths to explore full collections without touching a single piece of jewelry. Brands like Kendra Scott and DeBeers are already setting benchmarks by incorporating such features, gaining traction at every JCK show. Why is an AR Solution Important for Your Jewelry Brand? ​ According to research conducted by Engine Creative on AR solutions, this is what they find: 61% of customers say they prefer retailers with AR experience. 70% of shoppers are expected to be more loyal to brands offering AR interactions. AR can increase the conversion rates by up to 94%. Customers using AR are 3x more likely to engage with a product. With such promising numbers, it’s no surprise that JCK jewelry show exhibitors are embracing this tech revolution with open arms. Read More: Why You Need a Virtual Try-On for Your Jewellery eCommerce Website Increases Conversion ​ In the world of eCommerce, conversion is the topmost priority of any business. And AR has direct impact on boosting it. According to Shopify, brands who implemented AR features saw up to 94% higher conversion rate than those who don’t. With virtual try-on functionality, jewelry shoppers no longer hesitate. When they are more likely to hit the “Buy Now” button. Improved Customer Satisfaction AI and AR deliver personalization and interactivity—two key ingredients in customer satisfaction. A study by Deloitte highlights that 80% of consumers are more likely to purchase from brands that offer personalized experiences. AI algorithms can recommend matching sets, while AR lets users mix, match, and visualize pieces in real time. For example, a customer trying virtual try on jewellery might receive suggestions for complementary rings or bracelets based on face shape, previous interactions, or even seasonal trends. Lower Return Rates High return rates can cut deep into profits, especially for online jewelry sales where visual discrepancies are common. However, augmented reality helps bridge this gap. According to Retail Customer Experience, AR-driven retailers see 25% fewer returns compared to their non-AR competitors. Improve Brand Differentiation​ In a saturated market like the JCK jewelry show, brand differentiation is vital. Integrating AI and AR helps businesses stand out with innovation-led storytelling.
